content.description: This short climb starts by pulling on two black knobs (some may call them boobs) and following the smearing possibilities to some friendly handholds up top.
content.location: Climb is located on a south facing boulder that sits halfway up the clump that these climbs are from. From the turnout hike south east and scramble up a boulder gully. Halfway up you'll reach a "hallway" on the right. Squeeze through there and turn right again to find the bolts on your right.

content.description: Very easy for the grade. Follow up, and choose wisely, creaky and solid holds to the right.
content.protection: Quickdraws to a two-bolt anchor. Rap off the anchor on the left.
content.location: On the east side of Little Europe. From the turnout hike south east till you reach the east face. Look up on the "hillside" and spot several boulders in a row that all have climbs. Polish Pope and Polish Power are located on the same face and are the highest of the three bolted boulders.

content.description: Easy climbing till the top. Make a funky move to the right to get to a nice stance at the anchor. Well protected.
content.location: On the east side of Little Europe. From the turnout hike south east till you reach the east face. Look up on the "hillside" and spot several boulders in a row that all have climbs. Polish Pope and Polish Power are located on the same face and are the highest of the three bolted boulders.

content.description: Using crimps, smearing, with a committing and delicate move up, this climb gets progressively harder as you travel.
content.location: This route is located almost directly above Spooky Boobs. It is a pyramid shaped boulder that sits on the upper shelf of the crag. To get there from Spooky Boobs, head up and right then traverse left once on the upper shelf.

content.description: Either stem or face climb to the first bolt and trend right on good holds with some delicate climbing mixed in along the way. Pull a couple balancy and tough moves before cruising to the anchor. I led this twice and felt that it was pretty stiff for the 10a grade.
content.location: Route is located on the east side of Little Europe. Hike south east from the turnout until you are on the east side. Scramble to three or four boulders that all have bolts on them. This is the second climb from the left.
